label: 長者
本: From Sovereign to Symbol: An Age of Ritual Determinism in Fourteenth Century Japan . Oxford University Press . 2012
説明文: One of four men who were appointed as the head of Toji, the center of the Shingon world. Choja are divided into categories of the first" and "second," with the former in charge of temple administration and ritual affairs, although the functions of both overlapped. See also homu,jimu, and Toji."
